serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract:
World Countries 2008 is a polygon theme representing r the countries of the world as they existed in January 2008. Attribute information includes the name, UN status, population and area of the countries.
This dataset is a part of the 2008 ESRI Data and Maps Collection
descript.purpose: World Countries 2008 provides political boundaries for the world in 2008. To display World Political Organization Membership attributes or Census IPC Demographics attributes, join these tables to this attribute table using FIPS_CNTRY or CNTRY_NAME as the common attribute.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:15,000,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States: Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.4.1420

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry. The data set is created directly from a topologically correct ArcInfo coverage.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was originally extracted from the ArcWorld Supplement database and then generalized (tolerance unknown). The positional accuracy is unknown.

procstep.procdesc:
The following steps were performed by ESRI for Data & Maps 2002: Updated Saudi Arabia - Yemen border. Updated attributes for East Timor, Yugoslavia, Saudi Arabia, and Yemen. Recalculated attributes based on area. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr) and ArcView GIS legend file (.avl). Copied projection file (.prj) and created spatial indices.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted the features from ESRI Data & Maps 1999 data setcntry98.shp. Updated political boundaries and attributes for 2000 for Macau, Hong Kong, and East Timor. Extended political boundaries into the Caspian Sea and removed the shoreline. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr). Created ArcView GIS legend file (.avl). Created projection file (.prj). Created spatial indices.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Updated fields to reflect change from Yugoslavia to Serbia and Montenegro. Updated fields for East Timor, Romania, and Gaza Strip. Updated currency information for the European Euro. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Updated attribute values for East Timor, Serbia & Montenegro, and Taiwan. Recreated country regions, absorbing the province of Taiwan into the country of China. Removed the Paracel and Spratly island groups.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Added attributes ISO_NUM, ISOSHRTNAM, UNSHRTNAM, LOCSHRTNAM, LOCLNGNAM, and STATUS. Removed attributes SOVEREIGN, CURR_TYPE, CURR_CODE, and LANDLOCKED. Updated attribute values for LONG_NAME. Reduced the attribute width for CNTRY_NAME.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Renamed the attribute POP_CNTRY to POP2005, added the values from the World Factbook, and redefined the field width. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Split the single country of Serbia and Montenegro into separate countries of Montenegro and Serbia using the boundary from 2006 World Administrative Units. Coded their attribute values from the CIA The World Factbook, the International Organization for Standardization, and the United Nations websites. Updated the names for Afghanistan, Isle of Man, Myanmar, Rwanda, and Timor-Leste. Replaced POP2005 with POP2006 and coded it with values from the CIA The World Factbook website and gave the records that did not have population data values of -99999. Removed an area in the Netherlands where land was in the process of being reclaimed from the sea but was never completed. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Replaced POP2006 with POP2007 and coded it with values from the U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division/International Programs Center web site. Added the attribute LAND_SQKM and coded it with values from the CIA The World Factbook country web pages. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent the boundaries for the countries of the world as they existed in January 2008.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (two-letter) for the country.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The country code (three-letter) for the country from Global Mapping International.
The country code (two-letter) for the country from the International Organization for Standardization.
The country code (three-letter) for the country from the International Organization for Standardization.
The 3166-1-numeric-3 code for the country from the International Organization for Standardization.

attr.attrdefs: ArcWorld Supplement, Geographic and Global Issues, CIA Factbook
ArcWorld Supplement, Geographic and Global Issues, CIA Factbook

attr.attrdef: The short form of the country name from the International Organization for Standardization.
The short form of the country name from the United Nations Cartographic Section.
The local short form country name. This name is displayed using an English character set. It is blank for countries with no local short form name.
The local long form country name. This name is displayed using an English character set. It is blank for countries with no local long form name.

The United Nations political status of the political entity. This identifies whether the political entity is an independent United Nations member state, territory, occupied territory, dependency, etc.
The 2007 midyear estimated population of the country.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division/International Programs Center

attr.attrdef: The country area in square kilometers using an equal area projection.
The country area in square miles using an equal area projection.
The country area in square kilometers which is land (The World Factbook).
The number allows the country to be shaded uniquely from its neighbors.
